org.jcvi.jillion.testutils.assembly.cas

Class CasParserTestDouble.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.testutils.assembly.cas.CasParserTestDouble.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    CasParserTestDouble

    public static class CasParserTestDouble.Builder
extends Object
    This class allows arbitrary cas data to be visited without needing a real underlying CLC .cas encoded file. This allows test code to make up cas alignments to fit the situation under test. The builder will make all related reference and read files as well in case the visiting code needs to reference or parse them.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(File workingDir)
        throws IOException
        Parameters:
        workingDir -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Builder

        public Builder(File workingDir,
               RecordWriter... recordWriters)
        throws IOException
        Create a new Builder instance which will use the provided working directory to write all of its read and reference files.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - the working directory to use which will not only be the root of the reference and read files created but will also be returned by CasParser.getWorkingDir().
        recordWriters - RecordWriters to use to write the underlying read data. The record writers will be used in the provided order. The Builder to keep using a RecordWriter until it has reached its max records to be written as specified by RecordWriter.canWriteAnotherRecord(), then it will move onto the next RecordWriter. No RecordWriters can be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any recordWriters are null.
        IllegalStateException - if no RecordWriters are provided.
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the working directory or opening a file for writing in that directory.

      • Builder

        public Builder(File workingDir,
               File referenceFile,
               CasParserTestDouble.ReadFileGenerator readIdGenerator)
        throws IOException
        Create a new Builder instance which will use the provided working directory to write all of its read and reference files.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - the working directory to use which will not only be the root of the reference and read files created but will also be returned by CasParser.getWorkingDir().
        referenceFile - the File to write the reference sequence to; can not be null.
        recordWriters - RecordWriters to use to write the underlying read data. The record writers will be used in the provided order. The Builder to keep using a RecordWriter until it has reached its max records to be written as specified by RecordWriter.canWriteAnotherRecord(), then it will move onto the next RecordWriter. No RecordWriters can be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any recordWriters or referenceFile are null.
        IllegalStateException - if no RecordWriters are provided.
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the working directory or opening a file for writing in that directory.

    • Method Detail

      • addReference

        public CasParserTestDouble.Builder addReference(String name,
                                                String sequence)
        Add a reference with the given reference name and the provided full sequence. This reference can now be referred to by its name in forwardMatch(String, long) and reverseMatch(String, long) and the reference and sequence will be written to the reference fasta file.
        Parameters:
        name - the reference name.
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence as a String.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        IllegalStateException - if a reference with the same name already exists.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given sequence is emtpy or has any invalid bases.

      • forwardMatch

        public CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder forwardMatch(String refName,
                                                         long ungappedStart)
        Create a new CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder to make an alignment of a read that matches the given reference in the forward direction.
        Parameters:
        refName - the reference the read aligns to (this name must already exist by a previous call to addReference(String, String) ).
        ungappedStart - the ungapped left most offset (0- based) that this read begins to align to the reference PROVIDING COVERAGE. If the read starts off with trimmed off (CasAlignmentRegionType.INSERT ) bases, then this offset value should be the value after those.
        Returns:
        a new CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if refName is not known or if ungappedStart starts beyond the reference end.

      • reverseMatch

        public CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder reverseMatch(String refName,
                                                         long ungappedStart)
        Create a new CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder to make an alignment of a read that matches the given reference in the reverse direction.
        Parameters:
        refName - the reference the read aligns to (this name must already exist by a previous call to addReference(String, String) ).
        ungappedStart - the ungapped left most offset (0- based) that this read begins to align to the reference PROVIDING COVERAGE. If the read starts off with trimmed off (CasAlignmentRegionType.INSERT ) bases, then this offset value should be the value after those.
        Returns:
        a new CasParserTestDouble.AlignmentBuilder
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if refName is not known or if ungappedStart starts beyond the reference end.

      • build

        public CasParserTestDouble build()
                          throws IOException
        Write all the underlying read and reference files out and create a new CasParser instance that will make the visit calls that conform to the alignment data previously given.
        Returns:
        a new CasParser instance; will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing any of the files.
        IllegalStateException - if no alignments were written.

      • unMatched

        public CasParserTestDouble.Builder unMatched()
        Write a Read that did not align to any of the references. By default, this will write a new read with 10 Ns.
        Returns:
        this
